title: Add cybercrime helpline number 1930 to Help guidance content

requirements.summary: Add a prominent, English user-facing mention of the cybercrime helpline number "1930" on the "What to Do If You've Been Scammed" help content in a reporting-related section, without backend changes or external integrations.
acceptanceCriteria: The Help/What-to-do page includes the helpline number "1930" in visible user-facing text.
The mention of "1930" appears in a context related to reporting/seeking official help (not buried in unrelated content).
No backend/canister changes are required to display the helpline number.
The added text is in English and does not introduce non-functional links or external integrations.

file_operations.description: Update the Step 4: Report to Authorities section to explicitly mention the cybercrime helpline number "1930" as a reporting option in clear English (e.g., add a new checklist item or a short callout line within Step 4 content). Ensure the mention is prominent and clearly tied to reporting/official help. Do not add click-to-call behavior, external links, or integrations.

Reinforce the same "1930" helpline mention in the Resources & Evidence Collection area in a reporting-related accordion section (e.g., within "Finding Official Reporting Channels") to keep the number discoverable without being buried. Keep the text English-only and avoid adding external links, click-to-call, or any integration.
